titles.title: A joint resolution designating the beach at 53 degrees 53'51"N, 166 degrees 34'15"W to 53 degrees 53'48"N, 166 degrees 34'21"W on Hog Island, which lies in the Northeast Bay of Unalaska, Alaska as "Arkansas Beach" in commemoration of the 206th regiment of the National Guard, who served during the Japanese attack on Dutch Harbor, Unalaska on June 3 and 4, 1942.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S4155-4156)
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources requested executive comment from Department of the Interior, and Office of Management and Budget.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Johnston without amendment. With written report No. 103-96.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 141.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

calendar.text: Ordered to be Reported by Voice Vote.

action.text: Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations Discharged.
Reported by the Committee on Natural Resources. H. Rept. 103-294.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 101.

action.text: Mr. Vento moved to suspend the rules and pass the resolution.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

committee.name: Senate Energy and Natural Resources
committee.subcommittee: Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

bill.summary: 3/31/1993--Introduced. Names the beach on Hog Island, Unalaska, Alaska, the Arkansas Beach in commemoration of the 206th Coast Artillery Regiment and the men who served and died during the air attacks on Dutch Harbor, Unalaska, on June 3 and 4, 1942.
